author: Alden M. Monzon
title: Traders still complaining about LGU restrictions
text:
FILE PHOTO: REUTERS
Some local government units (LGUs) are still implementing policies and regulations that lead to delays and higher costs, prompting the interagency body regulating the prices of local goods to form a team to address these concerns.
The Department of Trade and Industry (DTI) on Wednesday night said that the National Price Coordinating Council (NPCC) has formed a technical working group that would be led by the Department of Justice (DOJ).
ADVERTISEMENT READ: Wanted: Other ways to reopen economy The DTI, which chairs the NPCC, said the DOJ has enforcement capabilities to correct the policies and procedures being implemented by LGUs.The issue was raised during the council‚Äôs meeting by the United Broilers Raisers Association Inc. (Ubra) and the Philippine Chamber of Food Manufacturers Inc.
FEATURED STORIES NEWSINFO Execs with access to ‚Äòroot server‚Äô may manipulate lottery system ‚Äî PCSO IT official NEWSINFO Public advisory: Take alternative walkways as footbridge demolition to begin in QC NEWSINFO VP Duterte to implement policies increasing take-home pay of teachers The two groups complained that the permits and restrictions from these LGUs were triggered by concerns about the spread of African swine flu.
In September last year, President Marcos ordered local governments to suspend the collection of so-called pass-through fees on national roads to ensure the efficient movement of goods and produce across the country.
Fowl raisers‚Äô concern The directive removed one of the extra logistical costs incurred by truckers as well as by manufacturing companies and agricultural producers that was ultimately passed on to consumers, according to Executive Order No. 4, which took effect on Sept. 28.
The order also ‚Äústrongly urged‚Äù the suspension of fees ‚Äúsuch as, but not limited to, sticker fees, discharging fees, delivery fees, market fees, toll fees, entry fees or mayor‚Äôs permit fees that are imposed upon all motor vehicles transporting goods and passing through any local public roads constructed and funded by ‚Ä¶ [LGUs].‚Äù
READ: BIZ BUZZ: Overbearing LGU mayor Ubra president Elias Jose Inciong told the Inquirer that restrictive regulations from some LGUs still persist today despite measures from the government last year to promote the ease of doing business by suspending pass-through fees.
‚ÄúOur main concern right now is their quarantine policies concerning the movement of animals. The requirements are not standard and it differs depending on the LGU. Some have strict requirements, others have less,‚Äù Inciong said in a phone interview.
ADVERTISEMENT He said the most tedious regulations were from Nueva Ecija, where they are having trouble when it comes to transporting chicks, particularly for day-old ones.
Multiple trips ‚ÄúIn other provinces, there are no requirements when transporting day-old chicks. The issuance of the veterinary certificate is also tedious for us,‚Äù he added, referring to the documentary requirement from the Provincial Veterinary Office.
The Ubra official added that another problem arising from this requirement was that the office often limited the volume of goods that could be transported, which meant they had to make multiple trips, thereby causing delays and additional fuel and manpower costs.
‚ÄúI understand that they can do this if there is an (avian flu) outbreak. But these regulations should not be there when there is none,‚Äù he pointed out.
‚ÄúWe have [raised this] with the [Department of the Interior and Local Government] and we are doing so again. Maybe we can still resolve this through a [meeting]. But right now, given the challenges in the poultry sector, we are just worried that things might just get worse,‚Äù Inciong said.
Price monitoring Aside from forming the new technical working group, the DTI said that the council also decided to look into the integration of price monitoring data from its different member agencies to stabilize prices.
‚ÄúThe DTI‚Äôs prime mandate is to protect consumers and ensure fair trade practices. We are proactively looking for the best possible ways to stabilize the supply of basic goods at reasonable prices,‚Äù said Trade Secretary Alfredo Pascual.
‚ÄúWe are also currently assessing restrictive market regulations that may affect the intent of producers to enter the Philippine market and the effectiveness of benchmarking prices of goods with other neighboring [Association of Southeast Asian Nations] countries,‚Äù he added.
In the meeting, the council also proposed to the Department of Agriculture to conduct weekend monitoring activities, and to collaborate with the DTI and the Department of Information and Communications Technology.
An integrated price monitoring would hopefully allow consumers to compare prices in different markets and buy where the lowest prices are available.

author: Adam Booker
title: üö® Mbapp√© scores three, PSG score nine in thumping of Revel
text:
PSG cruised away to sixth-tier side
[Revel](/en/team/revel-52710), advancing to the next round of the [Coupe de France](/en/competition/coupe-de-france-33/fixtures).
Scorers: Mbapp√© 16‚Ä≤ 45‚Ä≤, 48‚Ä≤, N‚ÄôGuessan (OG) 38‚Ä≤, Asensio 43‚Ä≤, Ramos (P) 71‚Ä≤, Kolo Muani 76‚Ä≤ 90‚Ä≤, Ndour 88‚Ä≤
Minnows
[Revel](/en/team/revel-52710) held on in the opening 15 minutes as [PSG](/en/team/psg-263) probed for the opener, but the solid rearguard wouldn‚Äôt remain that way for long as Kylian Mbapp√© broke the deadlock for the visitors.
PSG doubled their lead before the break thanks to a Maxence N‚ÄôGuessan own-goal after a pinpoint Nordi Mukiele cross.
The tie was all but killed off in the dying minutes of the half with goals from Marco Asensio and Kylian Mbapp√© seeing the visitors go four ahead of their hosts.
Mbapp√© started the second-half how he ended the first, tapping home from close range to complete his hat-trick.
Meanwhile,
[PSG](/en/team/psg-263) registered their sixth of the night from the penalty spot in the final 20 minutes, as Gon√ßalo Ramos dispatched from 12-yards.
Randal Kolo Muani would not allow himself to miss out on the scoring action however, tallying just five minutes after Ramos to put
[PSG](/en/team/psg-263) seven head in style.
The visitor‚Äôs lead grew to nine before the final whistle, capping off a thoroughly dominant
[PSG](/en/team/psg-263) showing.

author: La Jornada
title: La Jornada - "Si Israel globaliza la represi√≥n, nosotras la resistencia": estudiantes universitarias
text:
Ciudad de M√©xico. ‚ÄúSi Israel globaliza la represi√≥n, nosotras vamos a internacionalizar la resistencia‚Äù, lanzaron estudiantes de la Universidad Nacional Aut√≥noma de M√©xico (UNAM) en su primera declaraci√≥n pol√≠tica tras haber instalado ayer un campamento en apoyo a Palestina, a un costado de Rector√≠a.
En conferencia de prensa, en la zona conocida como ‚Äúlas islas‚Äù, los j√≥venes de diversas entidades de la UNAM, reiteraron su exigencia de ‚Äúfin al genocidio de Israel contra los palestinos y al apartheid, y respeto al derecho al retorno‚Äù de los desplazados.
Adem√°s demandaron ‚Äúante el mundo, la comunidad internacional y la sociedad civil que se le juzgue a Benjamin Netanyahu (primer ministro de Israel), a las autoridades c√≥mplices y a las empresas que est√°n aportando‚Äù a los ‚Äúcr√≠menes de lesa humanidad‚Äù.
-¬øCu√°l es el mensaje al rector de la UNAM?, se les pregunt√≥.
-¬°Lomel√≠, carajo, desconoce a Netanyahu!, y rompe las relaciones acad√©micas con las universidades de Israel, instaron.
En la zona de las islas, se han instalado 62 casas de campa√±a. Desde ah√≠, universitarios de las facultades de Filosof√≠a y Letras, de Ciencias Pol√≠ticas y Sociales, de Medicina, de la FES Acatl√°n, Arag√≥n, entre otras, lanzaron consignas como ‚Äú¬°Viva Palestina Libre!, ‚Äú¬°Desde el r√≠o hasta el mar, Palestina vencer√°!‚Äù, y ‚Äú¬°No es una guerra, es genocidio!‚Äù.
Enviaron tambi√©n un mensaje a los grupos afines a Israel: ‚ÄúEste movimiento es pac√≠fico. Nosotras no vamos a caer en provocaciones, no vamos a seguir su juego, al final nosotras estamos a favor de los derechos humanos, no solamente de los palestinos sino tambi√©n de todas las personas‚Äù, aseguraron.
‚ÄúLo que est√° sucediendo (con Palestina) justamente es un genocidio, ya no se puede tapar el sol con un dedo, estamos hablando de infancias y de mujeres‚Äù, manifestaron integrantes de la Asamblea y del campamento Interuniversitario y popular.
Tambi√©n anunciaron que el campamento es indefinido y que realizar√°n brigadas en diversas escuelas para informar a la comunidad. Asimismo, se tiene contemplado que en el transcurso del d√≠a se realicen actividades culturales, como danza, lectura de poes√≠a y clases de tejido.

author: Malay Mail
title: Three dead as Storm Gerrit batters Britain | Malay Mail
text:
> LONDON, Dec 29 ‚Äî Three people died yesterday after their car fell into a river in northern England, local police said, as Storm Gerrit battered much of the UK.
Emergency services headed to the River Esk near the town of Glaisdale shortly before midday (1200 GMT), after reports that a vehicle had fallen into the river.
‚ÄúThe vehicle was recovered from the river by the fire service just after 3:00 pm. Sadly, the three men inside have died,‚Äù North Yorkshire Police said.
Another man who had tried to help them was recovered unharmed, it said, adding that the weather conditions were ‚Äúmaking driving hazardous‚Äù.
Advertisement Several regions of the UK, particularly Scotland and northern England, have been badly hit by Storm Gerrit since Wednesday, which has brought heavy rain and snow.
Winds of up to 136 kilometres per hour (85 miles per hour) were recorded in Aberdeenshire in Scotland.
The UK‚Äôs Met Office said a supercell thunderstorm caused damage in Greater Manchester on Wednesday night, with features suggesting ‚Äúa tornado at the surface was likely‚Äù.
Advertisement Thousands of homes remained without power in Scotland on Thursday afternoon, while rail and air transport were disrupted with trains and flights cancelled.
Ferry services between Dover and France also suffered delays on Wednesday due to strong winds in the Channel. ‚Äî AFP

author: Business Wire
title: Life Is Chill Expands Line of THC Soft Gels with New Live Resin THC Capsules, A First Of Its Kind for the Arizona Market | User | mammothtimes.com
text:
The new plant-based soft gel will launch on Friday, January 19, providing Arizona consumers with a unique and innovative capsule option.
Ally Biotech, dba Life Is Chill, a science-based provider of leading-edge bioactive delivery solutions for cannabinoids, today announces the launch of its live resin soft-gel capsules, ResinTime, under its Life Is Chill product line. The initial offering to the market is vegan-friendly, a new innovative soft gel based on a tapioca-starch and sugar-free product that addresses some of the dietary needs of consumers. The launch of live resin capsules marks a new era for soft gels in the Arizona market and will meet the increasing demand for products made from fresh-frozen cannabis.
‚ÄúCapsules are an increasingly popular choice for those seeking a smoke-free and sugar-free product, but the common practice of using gelatin in pills makes them inaccessible to people who prefer plant-based products or people that have allergies to bovine gelatin,‚Äù said Francis Baczek, President at Life Is Chill. ‚ÄúOur newest addition to the Chill Pill product line solves this problem with the additional benefit of high-quality live resin.‚Äù
The ResinTime soft gels will officially launch on January 19th, 2024, at The Superior Dispensary in Phoenix. The vegan-friendly ResinTime is the company's newest addition to its current portfolio of easy-to-swallow THC soft-gel capsules, which includes six other variations: Day Caps, Night Caps, Anytime Caps, Anytime Hybrid+, Extreme Caps, and THCa Caps.
‚ÄúWe are honored to kick off the launch of these live resin soft gels, a first of its kind in the Arizona market,‚Äù said Steve Shapiro, founder and CEO of The Superior Dispensary. ‚ÄúAs a vegan, I‚Äôm excited to have a vegan-friendly product available for consumers. These capsules will provide another great option for customers seeking new ways to consume live resin-based products in an easily digestible way.‚Äù
The award-winning soft gel brand is available in dozens of dispensaries across the state and has cemented itself as an Arizona staple for almost a decade. With the global cannabis capsule market expected to reach $108.14 billion by 2029, according to Data Bridge Market Research, and at least 6% of the American population identifying as either vegetarian or vegan, this new launch will meet the growing demand for dietary-friendly live resin products and provide an inhalation-free and sugar-free method of consumption for Arizona cannabis users.
The new product launch follows Ally Biotech‚Äôs acquisition of the Chill Pill line in the spring of 2023. It continues the company‚Äôs plan to expand its product line and establish itself as a market leader in the soft gel category. For more information about the Chill Pill, visit Lifeischill.com.
About Life Is Chill:
The Arizona-based Life Is Chill brand is an expansive line of easy-to-swallow THC soft gels for the cannabis industry. Formulated using hemp seed oil, Chill Pills are sugar-free, easy to absorb and metabolize, and come in various strengths and strains, with effects ranging from highly responsive to highly relaxed. Life Is Chill is owned and operated by Ally Biotech, a company committed to harnessing the power of science to create innovative THC products. For more information, visit Lifeischill.com .
About Ally Biotech:
Headquartered in Payson, Arizona, Ally Biotech manufactures highly bioavailable products. The company‚Äôs Lipofusion¬Æ delivery technology combines nanotechnology and liposomal science to speed product differentiation and innovation. The company‚Äôs products undergo rigorous testing for purity, potency, safety, and efficacy at third-party laboratories. For more information, visit AllyBiotech.com . For more information about the Life Is Chill brand, please visit Lifeischill.com.

author: Timothy Schafer; Story
title: Call for special mediator arises in ferry workers' labour dispute (Nelson)
text:
Binding arbitration is necessary for the inland ferry workers‚Äô labour dispute in the West Kootenay in order for the process to move forward and conclude, says the employer.
Western Pacific Marine (WPM) said it would welcome a B.C. General Employees‚Äô Union (BCGEU) request for a special mediator in moving toward resolution of the contract dispute and negotiations, which began in earnest in early November of last year.
However, the arrangement must be binding arbitration ‚Äî a legally binding decision, similar to a court order ‚Äî to be most effective and impartial way to achieve a fair resolution, said Odai Sirri, general manager of WPM.
Sirri felt an independent arbitrator would examine the facts and make a balanced ruling in the best interests of all parties.
‚ÄúWe have addressed the union‚Äôs core demands and presented fair proposals that ensure both competitive wages and long-term service reliability,‚Äù said Sirri in a statement released earlier today. ‚ÄúWhile we support the special mediation process, we still believe that binding arbitration would provide the quickest, most equitable resolution by relying on facts rather than rhetoric.‚Äù
In a press release this morning, the BCGEU noted that it has reached out to the provincial minister of Labour, Jennifer Whiteside, requesting the appointment of a special mediator to help resolve the ongoing strike between WPM and BCGEU ferry workers in the Kootenay region.
‚ÄúAs our bargaining committee continues to push for a deal, our priority remains finding a resolution that benefits both ferry workers and the community they serve,‚Äù said BCGEU president Paul Finch in the statement. ‚ÄúAfter five months on strike, workers want to return to full-time work with the security of a fair collective agreement that will ensure service levels are preserved for years to come.‚Äù

author: @kctv5
title: Cher files for conservatorship over son due to alleged substance abuse
text:
(TMX) -- Cher has filed for conservatorship of her son Elijah Blue Allman‚Äôs estate due to alleged substance abuse problems.
The 77-year-old music icon is seeking to be the sole conservator of her son‚Äôs estate, according to documents filed in Los Angeles. Cher claims Allman, 47, is ‚Äúcurrently unable to manage his assets due to severe mental health and substance abuse issues.‚Äù
The filing says a conservator is ‚Äúurgently needed‚Äù because he is due to receive a payout from his trust before the end of the year.
‚ÄúElijah is entitled to regular distributions from the Trust, but given his ongoing mental health and substance abuse issues, [Cher] is concerned that any funds distributed to Elijah will be immediately spent on drugs, leaving Elijah with no assets to provide for himself and putting Elijah‚Äôs life at risk,‚Äù the filing states.
Allman is Cher‚Äôs youngest child, and his father is the late musician Gregg Allman.
According to the filing, Allman‚Äôs estranged wife, Marieangela King, is unfit to be conservator as ‚Äútheir tumultuous relationship has been marked by a cycle of drug addiction and mental health crises.‚Äù
Earlier this year, Cher was accused of kidnapping after reports surfaced that she allegedly hired four men to retrieve Allman from a New York hotel in November 2022 as part of an intervention. King, 36, alleged Cher hired the men to stop him from reconciling with her and save their marriage.
Cher denied the reports.
According to the conservatorship filing, Cher ‚Äúworked tirelessly to get Elijah into treatment and get him the help he needs.‚Äù

author: Kim Holcomb
title: From lumber to lattes and libations - historic Weyerhaeuser Building in Everett gets new life
text:
EVERETT, Wash. ‚Äî Whether it's the start of a busy day or the conclusion of a good night, there‚Äôs a seat at the table for you inside one of Everett's most recognizable buildings.
The Muse Whiskey & Coffee recently opened inside the historic Weyerhaeuser Building on the waterfront and serves both coffee and cocktails.
"It's been a staple, this building - everyone's seen it for years floating around Everett, wherever it may be,‚Äù said General Manager Jospeh Mottola.
The building was constructed in 1923 and used for the lumber company's administration offices. It also served as a showroom for wood products.
In later years, Weyerhaeuser no longer used the space and the building was moved to different parts of the city - three times. It was eventually designated historic, but it didn‚Äôt have a functional public purpose.
Then, Jack Ng and Jin Ma came along.
"Jin came from one of the biggest cities in the world, Beijing, and met me in the smallest town in the world, little Langley on Whidbey Island,‚Äù Ng said.
Together, the couple saw the Weyerhaeuser Building‚Äôs potential and worked with the
Port of Everett to create a new public/private partnership.
The Muse Whiskey and Coffee turned former offices into comfortable and stylish seating areas. The westerly hallway leads to a spacious deck with views of the water. Ma designed the d√©cor, inspired by a trip she and Ng made to Scotland - down to the light switches.
"The only place you can get them is Europe, so we had them shipped from Europe,‚Äù Ng said. "We wanted to make it more unique and different."
They're also honoring the past.
Original woodwork was restored, QR codes on plaques connect guests with history lessons, and the Muse logo was inspired by art from the original windows. They even commissioned a painting of Frederick Weyerhaeuser, which hangs next to the speakeasy bar.
The coffee bar is open daily and run by Keppy Ross ‚Äì who used to run past the building.
"It's like I was meant to be here,‚Äù Ross said, laughing.
The caf√© serves Italian traditional coffee and grab-and-go pastries and treats. Within a month of opening, Ross said there were already regular customers with regular routines.
"The window in the big room,‚Äù Ross said. "That is the spot to sit in here and we have a lot of people come in and want to claim that spot right in the morning."
In the evening, the speakeasy beckons.
"Really kind of brings you back to a different era,‚Äù Mottola said.
Bartenders specialize in craft cocktails and the extensive whiskey collection includes some Prohibition-era bottles. More spirits are stored in the original vault, which was originally used for payroll. Now, it‚Äôs filled with lockers customers can rent to store their favorite bottles.
From lumber to lattes libations, the building has served the community for generations - and counting.
"I hope this is the last move for the next 100 years,‚Äù Ng said.
The Muse Whiskey & Coffee is open daily and located at 615 Millwright Loop in Everett.

author: Redacci√≥n Peru21
title: ¬°Conmovedor! Perrito 'consuela' a hombre que interpretaba a Jes√∫s durante el V√≠a Crucis | semana santa | semana santa 2024 | guatemala | V√≠a Crucis | Sumpango | | REDES-SOCIALES | PERU21
text: En Sumpango, [Guatemala](https://peru21.pe/buscar/Guatemala/todas/descendiente/?query=Guatemala/), la representaci√≥n del V√≠a Crucis fue escenario de un momento enternecedor. Un perrito, que pasaba por el lugar, se acerc√≥ para ‚Äòconsolar‚Äô al hombre que interpretaba a Jes√∫s, quien se encontraba ensangrentado en el piso. MIRA: [Semana Santa: Sutran interviene a colectiveros informales llevando pasajeros a Pisco, Ca√±ete e Ica] La fotograf√≠a de la conmovedora situaci√≥n se volvi√≥ r√°pidamente viral en las redes sociales y los usuarios se√±alaron que el can habr√≠a sentido empat√≠a al ver al hombre sufrir. La imagen fue compartida por la fundaci√≥n ‚ÄòToby‚Äô, una organizaci√≥n mexicana dedicada al rescate y adopci√≥n de animales en situaci√≥n de maltrato y/o abandono. ‚ÄúUn perrito no logra entender porqu√© lo lastiman, pero quer√≠a acercarse para consolarlo y hacerle saber que no est√° solo. NO TODOS ENTIENDEN LO QUE ES EL AMOR AL PR√ìJIMO‚Äù, escribieron. Per√∫21 ePaper, [ingresa aqu√≠ ](https://epaper.peru21.pe/)y pru√©balo gratis.

author: Diario del AltoArag√≥n
title: El operativo de prevenci√≥n de incendios de Sarga se extiende a todo el a√±o
text: MEDIO AMBIENTE El operativo de prevenci√≥n de incendios de Sarga se extiende a todo el a√±o La consejer√≠a de Medio Ambiente de la DGA ampl√≠a el presupuesto a 31,9 millones de euros El consejero de Medio Ambiente y Turismo ha comparecido esta ma√±ana en las Cortes de Arag√≥n para detallar la orden de encargo a Sarga en materia forestal, a petici√≥n de PSOE, y asegurar que ‚Äúse va a extender el operativo de prevenci√≥n y extinci√≥n de incendios a los doce meses, con una ampliaci√≥n presupuestaria de 3,2 millones de euros" que, unida a lo presupuestado, llegar√° a ‚Äú31,9 millones de euros que garantizan que los trabajadores seguir√°n en Sarga hasta final de a√±o y el resto de a√±os quedar√° de esta forma‚Äù. Sobre la negociaci√≥n del convenio colectivo de Sarga, Manuel Blasco ha manifestado que el gobierno anterior ‚Äúno intent√≥ renovarlo durante cuatro a√±os‚Äù y, por ello, ‚Äúllevamos m√°s de veintid√≥s reuniones y todo un a√±o con una clara voluntad de mejorar la vida laboral y seguridad de 1.500 trabajadores‚Äù, ha indicado. Asimismo, ha explicado que la ampliaci√≥n a doce meses para los trabajadores que integran el dispositivo de incendios tiene como objetivo que ‚Äúno solo est√©n trabajando los meses de m√°xima activaci√≥n, sino que puedan realizar labores de prevenci√≥n y de limpieza el resto del a√±o‚Äù. Por otra parte, el consejero de Medio Ambiente ha apostado por la gesti√≥n forestal para ‚Äúpoder acometer la limpieza de los montes‚Äù porque ‚Äúse observa falta de limpieza en muchos r√≠os‚Äù o de aprovechamiento de la biomasa y, en este sentido, ha incidido en ‚Äúconseguir que los ayuntamientos puedan volver a sacar cortas de madera para aprovecharla como elemento capital‚Äù. Adem√°s, ha destacado que el plan de reforestaci√≥n ‚Äúest√° preparado‚Äù, que ya se est√° trabajando para renovar una parte de los veh√≠culos que se van a utilizar o para preparar las plantas en los viveros y que espera que ‚Äúse pueda poner en marcha con 2 millones de euros cada a√±o de aportaci√≥n p√∫blica con los presupuestos‚Äù. Desde el grupo Socialista, grupo solicitante de la comparecencia, Leticia Soria ha mostrado su preocupaci√≥n por ‚Äúla situaci√≥n actual y el rumbo de las cuadrillas forestales de Sarga de las que dependen cientos de trabajadores‚Äù, porque ‚Äúva a acabar el plazo para cerrar los acuerdos para permitir su continuidad durante todo el a√±o‚Äù. Adem√°s, ha reiterado que el Gobierno de Arag√≥n ‚Äúno tiene una pol√≠tica forestal y su falta de planificaci√≥n est√° dejando una situaci√≥n comprometida‚Äù, "no vemos una hoja de ruta clara y apagan fuegos sobre la marcha‚Äù, ha sentenciado. La parlamentaria popular Susana Cobos ha puesto en valor que, con la ampliaci√≥n a doce meses, ‚Äúse ha atendido una demanda hist√≥rica‚Äù y que el Gobierno de Arag√≥n ‚Äúse preocupa por todos los trabajadores de Sarga y por su continuidad y estabilidad laboral‚Äù. El portavoz sectorial de Vox, Juan Vidal, ha solicitado revisar el Plan Estrat√©gico de Reforestaci√≥n porque su objetivo era ‚Äúel de la plantaci√≥n de 2 millones de √°rboles en 2.000 hect√°reas por un periodo de cuatro a√±os‚Äù, una cantidad que ‚Äúllama la atenci√≥n‚Äù porque ‚Äúcoincide con la cantidad de √°rboles que el t√°ndem Forestalia ‚Äì MITER se ha propuesto arrancar‚Äù. Joaqu√≠n Palac√≠n (CHA) ha puesto de manifiesto que los trabajadores ‚Äúestaban preocupados porque no sab√≠an si iban a continuar y necesitan certidumbre y estabilidad laboral, que las condiciones sean dignas y que permitan fijar poblaci√≥n en el medio rural‚Äù. Del mismo modo, Joaqu√≠n Moreno (Arag√≥n-Teruel Existe) ha celebrado la ampliaci√≥n de la contrataci√≥n de diez a doce meses porque ‚Äúva a dar estabilidad, a fijar poblaci√≥n y generar un clima de confianza‚Äù, a la vez que ha querido reconocer ‚Äúla labor y trabajo de Sarga tras una de las primaveras m√°s secas de los √∫ltimos a√±os‚Äù. Desde el Grupo Mixto, Andoni Corrales (Podemos) ha criticado ‚Äúel cinismo del PSOE‚Äù porque ‚Äúllevamos a√±os intentando que el operativo de incendios sea profesional‚Äù y ha preguntado al consejero si ‚Äúlos bomberos y bomberas forestales van a empezar el 1 de enero el a√±o que viene‚Äù y sobre la situaci√≥n de los puntos de encuentro.
